result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moriatey Tarvon Parker

records.addlTxt: of Representation by Attorney Fard

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Moriatey Tarvon Parker.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for review hearing.
Parties review report dated 04-29-22 submitted by Dr. Collins. State does not challenge the report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.  
Parties stipulate that the Court may use the Doctor's Report as a factual basis.  
Based upon the forensic evaluations filed with the Court and the record before it, having determined pursuant to 971.147, Wis. Stats., the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to stand trial and is not likely to regain competency within the remaining commitment period under Chapter 971.  
Upon Petition for Conversion filed by the Assistant District Attorney, Court orders the proceedings converted to proceedings under Ch. 51, Stats., and the criminal complaint, statements of witnesses, transcripts and forensic evaluation reports shall serve as a law enforcement officer's statement of detention under Chapter 51, Stats.  
Court further ordered the criminal proceedings suspended and defendant REMANDED to the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff, who shall FORTHWITH convey defendant to the Behavioral Health Division "BHD", where defendant shall be held for proceedings under Chapter 51, Stats., where he shall receive a psychiatric evaluation within 24 hours of admission to determine whether he is a proper subject for commitment under Ch. 51.

Defense counsel requests defendant's property be returned. State has no objection. Court grants return of property to defendant. 

Order of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Under 971.14(6)(b) Wis. Stats., signed at 11:33 a.m., filed and distributed.

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Competency Hearing proceeded.  
Defendant does challenge Dr. Collins report.   Court qualified Dr. Collins to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Collins. Testimony closed. State does not challenge Dr. Collins' report.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Collins, and testimony of Dr. Collins, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent. By direction of the Court, defendant removed from proceedings due to disruption. Court found the defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility.  

The defendant shall be given 80 days of credit for re commitment incarceration.  The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report on August 26, 2022,  at 9:00 a.m. in Branch 37. All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed Dr. Collins' report with all parties. Attorney Fard has been unable to fully review the report with defendant. Court held colloquy with defendant who disagrees with Dr. Collins' findings that he is incompetent. Matter remains scheduled in Br. 37.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Dr. Collins report dated 4/29/2022, received and filed

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Deputy court clerk:  vk    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing. Assistant district attorney assigned to this matter is out sick. State requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request. Court adjourns matter for a status to determine the direction of the case. Defense request to be heard as to bail. Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Deputy court clerk:  vk   Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 37 to be heard with 21CM1238.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Moriatey Tarvon Parker in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Moriatey Tarvon Parker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
